title: Gillian Bourke
text:
Gillian Bourke (born 28 August 1984) is a female <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. She represented at the <a href="2010%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2010</a> and <a href="2014%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2014 Women's Rugby World Cup</a>, where she was voted the Number 2 position in the WRWC Team of the Tournament. 
She has 51 caps for Ireland, playing from 2008-2015, winning the Six Nations Grand Slam in 2013, and the Six Nations Championship in 2015.
She was also invited to play with the legendary Barbarians team in February 2018 against the British Army, and again in April 2019 against the USA Women’s National team in Denver, Colorado. She was voted Munster Women’s Player of the Year for the 2017-18 season. 
In August 2019, she moved from her club Stade Francais in Paris to join Tyrrell’s Premier 15s giants Harlequins.
Bourke studied Sport Science at the <a href="University%20of%20Limerick">University of Limerick</a>. She is a performance analyst.
She works as a Game Analyst with World Rugby.
